snippet: For supporters of stronger regulation, it comes down to a choice between someone they don’t know, Janet Yellen, and someone they don’t trust, Lawrence H. Summers.
abstract: Lawrence H Summers and Janet Yellen, now leading candidates to head Federal Reserve, are likely to spend more time on financial regulation than previous Fed chairmen; both candidates share similar views on regulatory issues and followed similar career trajectories, leaving supporters of stronger regulation to choose between someone they do not know well, in Yellen, or someone they may not trust, in Summers.
lead_paragraph: For supporters of stronger regulation, it comes down to a choice between someone they don’t know, Janet Yellen, and someone they don’t trust, Lawrence H. Summers.

headline.main: Divining the Regulatory Goals of Fed Rivals
headline.print_headline: Divining the Regulatory Goals of Fed Rivals

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
